intro: Galactia tashiroi, commonly known as the Tashiro's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Galactia tashiroi typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its seed pods contain small, hard seeds that are dispersed by wind, contributing to its survival in harsh conditions.
